content.content: Certain deadly infectious diseases like polio, measles and pneumonia can be prevented by vaccinations. Hand washing, clean water, sanitation and nutrition can’t prevent all infectious diseases, especially germs in the air.[^83] Getting these diseases can cause serious complications like paralysis, birth defects, liver cancer, pneumonia and death.[^83] Babies and young children aren’t able to fight these diseases because of their immature immune systems. They will be protected from these diseases by vaccinations before they get them.[^83] Adults are at risk from infectious diseases because of age, health conditions like diabetes, lifestyles and travel.[^83] Protect yourselves, loved ones and your community by being up-to-date with the recommended vaccinations.
